intro: Brassica rapa subvar. pe-tsai, commonly known as Chinese cabbage, is a leafy vegetable with a distinctively swollen, bulbous stem. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family and is native to East Asia. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with broad, fleshy leaves that are often harvested before the stem becomes fully developed. Its crisp texture and mild, slightly sweet flavor make it a popular ingredient in various Asian cuisines.
